intro: Kleinia scottioides, commonly known as the Cape dune star, is a succulent shrub native to the coastal regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal and arid environments. Kleinia scottioides is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
